result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua Ellis Johnson was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Johnson to 3 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 1/2 years, and the maximum term to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 1/2 years. The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Johnson on Probation for two years

--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months

--6 demerit points assessed
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period

miscConds.notes:
--no possession or consumption of alcohol

--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores

timeConds.notes:
--to serve 10 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges; the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this Jail term to another county conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring or other passive service of the jail term.   The Court sets the commencement date to be May 21st, 2022 upon the conclusion of the service of the current Waukesha County Jail term.  

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

--DNA sample provision

Criminal Case Settlement
Huber

[MK] case called at 2:15pm. 
Defendant Joshua Ellis Johnson in court [on Waukesha County Jail Huber Release] with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.   
Constitutional rights reviewed; the charges and maximum penalties are recited
recess 2:24pm for Mr. Johnson and Attorney Huebner to meet. 
reconvene 2:36pm 
Plea of "No Contest" is entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Johnson guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2.  Further the Court reopens the related refusal case #21TR3969, vacates the Judgment and dismisses that case. 
Sentencing arguments are given.  
recess 3:00pm, reconvene 3:16pm.  

On Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Johnson to 3 years, with an Intial Term of Confinenment in Prison of 1 1/2 years, and the maximum term to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 1/2 years.
The Court finds that Mr. Johnson is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.
Days credit for time already served:  1 day

The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Johnson on Probation for two years, with conditions:  
--to serve 10 months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges; the Court authorizes transfer of the service of this Jail term to another county conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring or other passive service of the jail term.   The Court sets the commencement date to be May 21st, 2022 upon the conclusion of the service of the current Waukesha County Jail term.  
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and Agent approval 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or therapy per Agent
--to take all prescribed medications only as prescribed by a treating prescriber
--to pay fine of $3,000+ costs      
--DNA sample provision

The Court orders outright [not as conditions of Probation]:  
--DNA sample provision
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment
--Victim Impact Panel attendance 
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
The Court specifies that Mr. Johnson may travel back independently to the Huber facility in the Waukesha County Jail. He is not taken into custody at this time. 
recess 3:33pm

Plea/sentencing hearing on March 4, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

[ml] Case called at 2:31PM
[All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Joshua Ellis Johnson appears. Attorney Karl E Huebner appears. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that the Zoom connection is sight and sound sufficient.

This hearing is scheduled for a Final Conference, however att Huebner advises that these matters will not be heading to trial, and requests that these matters be scheduled for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing with a short return.
The Court reschedules these matters for a Plea and Sentencing Hearing with the Defendant in person.
The Court instructs the Clerk to fax notice of the next scheduled hearing to the Waukesha County Jail. Furthermore, the Court demands an affirmative response, and orders that the Defendant be allowed to appear in court, in person via his temporary release from the Waukesha Huber Facility.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 7/22/21 at 12:45 pm.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**
